data.description: Who We Are:At Neurocrine Biosciences, we pride ourselves on having a strong, inclusive, and positive culture based on our shared purpose and values. We know what it takes to be great, and we are as passionate about our people as we are about our purpose - to relieve suffering for people with great needs. What We Do:Neurocrine Biosciences is a leading neuroscience-focused, biopharmaceutical company with a simple purpose: to relieve suffering for people with great needs. We are dedicated to discovering and developing life-changing treatments for patients with under-addressed neurological, neuroendocrine and neuropsychiatric disorders. The company's diverse portfolio includes FDA-approved treatments for tardive dyskinesia, chorea associated with Huntington's disease, classic congenital adrenal hyperplasia, endometriosis* and uterine fibroids,* as well as a robust pipeline including multiple compounds in mid- to late-phase clinical development across our core therapeutic areas. For three decades, we have applied our unique insight into neuroscience and the interconnections between brain and body systems to treat complex conditions. We relentlessly pursue medicines to ease the burden of debilitating diseases and disorders because you deserve brave science. For more information, visit neurocrine.com, and follow the company on LinkedIn, X and Facebook. (*in collaboration with AbbVie)About the Role:Neurocrine Biosciences, Inc. (NASDAQ: NBIX) is offering the opportunity to gain Data Analytics experience in the world of biotechnology. Our intern program offers exposure to Supply Chain, Data Analytics, and Business Operations. The Supply Chain Data Analytics team has a strong reputation in the industry for converting raw data into tools and reports for departments such as our Supply Chain, Quality Assurance, and other teams to leverage to make business decisions backed by data._Your Contributions (include, but are not limited to):Support a range of activities, including Report creating, dataset restructure and data clean upAssists the Data Analytics team to improve existing reportsAssist with updating back-end datasets to improve refreshes and dataset load timesAssist with improving data pipelines into concise dataflowsActively participate in cross-functional team initiatives, collaborating with various departments such as Supply Chain, Quality Assurance, and ITCollaborate with a team of cross-functional team mentors as well as the other interns in the classComplete a special project and present the recommendations to senior managementRequirements:Pursuing an undergraduate degree with an interest in supply chain management, operations management, computer science or data science and must have completed a minimum of two yearsSpecific degree or field required: Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field.Knowledge of databases, Power BI, SQL/python is a plus.Prior experience in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry would be an asset but is not requiredProficient in Microsoft Office suite and familiarity with visualization software (example: PowerBI, Tableau)Familiarity with biopharmaceutical technologies, physical and life sciences, product development, and regulatory approval processes is desirableGood verbal and written communication skillsAbility to think creatively and be a team playerOffer flexibility with a willingness to work on multiple projects simultaneouslyInterest in attending various program events, including social gatherings, career development workshops, and moreAbility to commit to a 10-week, full-time summer program​Neurocrine Biosciences is an EEO/Disability/Vets employer.We are committed to building a workplace of belonging, respect, and empowerment, and we recognize there are a variety of ways to meet our requirements. We are looking for the best candidate for the job and encourage you to apply even if your experience or qualifications don’t line up to exactly what we have outlined in the job description.
requirements: Pursuing an undergraduate degree with an interest in supply chain management, operations management, computer science or data science and must have completed a minimum of two years
Specific degree or field required: Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Prior experience in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry would be an asset but is not required
responsibilities: Collaborate with a team of cross-functional team mentors as well as the other interns in the class
Familiarity with biopharmaceutical technologies, physical and life sciences, product development, and regulatory approval processes is desirable
Offer flexibility with a willingness to work on multiple projects simultaneously
Interest in attending various program events, including social gatherings, career development workshops, and more
